name: ktistec
description: Ktistec is a small ActivityPub capable microblogging server written in Rust. It allows users to host their own federated social account with timelines, follows and posts, talking to the wider Fediverse from a minimal codebase.
features: ActivityPub Protocol: Federated microblogging compatible with Mastodon and Fediverse. Join decentralized social web.
Personal Instance: Run your own single-user or small community instance. Own your social media presence.
Timeline: View posts from people you follow in chronological timeline. Stay updated with connections.
Posts & Replies: Create posts, reply to others, and engage in conversations. Full microblogging functionality.
Follow System: Follow users across the Fediverse and gain followers. Build your network.
Media Attachments: Share images and files with your posts. Rich content sharing.
Notifications: Get notified of mentions, replies, and new followers. Stay engaged with community.
Minimal Codebase: Lightweight server with small resource footprint. Run on modest hardware.
Fast Performance: Quick page loads and responsive interface. Smooth user experience.
Easy Deployment: Simple setup and configuration process. Get started quickly.
Privacy Controls: Control post visibility and follower approval. Manage your privacy.
Web Interface: Clean, functional web UI for all social features. No separate client needed.
